page.title: 14Befcote Farm, near Gnosall
page.content: Farming is the most important economic activity in the countryside surrounding Gnosall. There are 15 farms named in the area of our survey. We went to visit one of the largest and most modern of the farms in our area, Befcote Farm. 835 acres of land are farmed. There are 160a of winter wheat, 80a of winter barley, 47a of spring barley, 40a of sugar beet, 13a of fodder beet and 460a of grass of which 300a are used for silage. The winter wheat and barley are planted before Christmas and the spring barley in March. There are 2 or 3 cuts of grass for silage There is a dairy herd of 295 Friesians and altogether 691 cattle. The farm produces 6,000 litres of milk per day. It takes about 1.5 hours to milk about 200 cows. There are ten workers on the farm. It is very modern.
